title: Understanding Spontaneity and Ecell
text: Recall that a spontaneous reaction is one that occurs naturally without external input. How does the sign of Ecell◦ relate to spontaneity?

title: Gibbs Free Energy and Ecell Relationship
text: The relationship between Gibbs free energy change (∆G) and the standard cell potential (Ecell◦) is given by the equation: $$∆G=-nFEcell◦$$. What does this equation tell you about the sign of ∆G when Ecell◦ is negative?

title: Analyzing the Equation
text: Given the equation $$∆G=-nFEcell◦$$, if Ecell◦ is negative, what will be the sign of ∆G?

title: Conclusion on Spontaneity
text: If ∆G is positive, is the reaction spontaneous or non-spontaneous?

title: Final Answer
text: Based on your understanding of the relationship between Ecell◦, ∆G, and spontaneity, is the statement true or false?
